page.title: 07A GRAYS SCHOOL, 1946
page.content: As part of our Domesday project we visited a retired teacher who had taught at our school for many years.She was born in Tilbury and has lived in this area all of her life.She started teaching in 1946 and retired in 1983 after many years of hard work.During that time she witnessed many changes at the school-four head teachers,many teachers and countless children.She told us that the building had been extended to include a kitchen and dining room.Her original room had desks which were bolted to the floor and there were often classes of fifty children.They used pens with steel nibs,dipping the pens into inkwells.Lessons were formal,desks in rows with the teacher's desk at the front.
